speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: SCENE I. Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRAs palace.

speaker: ROSALIND
text_entry: Enter DEMETRIUS and PHILO

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Nay, but this dotage of our generals

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Oerflows the measure: those his goodly eyes,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: That oer the files and musters of the war

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Have glowd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The office and devotion of their view

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Upon a tawny front: his captains heart,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: And is become the bellows and the fan

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: To cool a gipsys lust.

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Look, where they come:

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Take but good note, and you shall see in him.

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: The triple pillar of the world transformd

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Into a strumpets fool: behold and see.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Theres beggary in the love that can be reckond.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ill set a bourn how far to be beloved.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter an Attendant

speaker: Attendant
text_entry: News, my good lord, from Rome.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Grates me: the sum.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Nay, hear them, Antony:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Fulvia perchance is angry; or, who knows

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If the scarce-bearded Caesar have not sent

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: His powerful mandate to you, Do this, or this;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Perform t, or else we damn thee.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How, my love!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Perchance! nay, and most like:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: You must not stay here longer, your dismission

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is come from Caesar; therefore hear it, Antony.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Wheres Fulvias process? Caesars I would say? both?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Call in the messengers. As I am Egypts queen,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou blushest, Antony; and that blood of thine

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is Caesars homager: else so thy cheek pays shame

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: When shrill-tongued Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of the ranged empire fall! Here is my space.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Kingdoms are clay: our dungy earth alike

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Feeds beast as man: the nobleness of life

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Is to do thus; when such a mutual pair

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Embracing

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And such a twain can dot, in which I bind,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: On pain of punishment, the world to weet

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We stand up peerless.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Excellent falsehood!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ill seem the fool I am not; Antony

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Will be himself.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: But stirrd by Cleopatra.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Now, for the love of Love and her soft hours,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Lets not confound the time with conference harsh:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Theres not a minute of our lives should stretch

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Hear the ambassadors.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Fie, wrangling queen!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whom every thing becomes, to chide, to laugh,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To weep; whose every passion fully strives

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To make itself, in thee, fair and admired!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: No messenger, but thine; and all alone

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To-night well wander through the streets and note

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The qualities of people. Come, my queen;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Last night you did desire it: speak not to us.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with their train

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Is Caesar with Antonius prized so slight?

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Sir, sometimes, when he is not Antony,

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: He comes too short of that great property

speaker: PHILO
text_entry: Which still should go with Antony.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: I am full sorry

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: That he approves the common liar, who

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Thus speaks of him at Rome: but I will hope

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Of better deeds to-morrow. Rest you happy!

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. Another room.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Enter CHARMIAN, IRAS, ALEXAS, and a Soothsayer

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Lord Alexas, sweet Alexas, most any thing Alexas,

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: almost most absolute Alexas, wheres the soothsayer

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: that you praised so to the queen? O, that I knew

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: this husband, which, you say, must charge his horns

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: with garlands!

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Soothsayer!

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Your will?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Is this the man? Ist you, sir, that know things?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: In natures infinite book of secrecy

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: A little I can read.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Show him your hand.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Bring in the banquet quickly; wine enough

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Cleopatras health to drink.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good sir, give me good fortune.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I make not, but foresee.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Pray, then, foresee me one.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: You shall be yet far fairer than you are.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: He means in flesh.

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: No, you shall paint when you are old.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Wrinkles forbid!

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Vex not his prescience; be attentive.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Hush!

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: You shall be more beloving than beloved.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: I had rather heat my liver with drinking.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Nay, hear him.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good now, some excellent fortune! Let me be married

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: to three kings in a forenoon, and widow them all:

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: let me have a child at fifty, to whom Herod of Jewry

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: may do homage: find me to marry me with Octavius

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Caesar, and companion me with my mistress.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: You shall outlive the lady whom you serve.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: O excellent! I love long life better than figs.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: You have seen and proved a fairer former fortune

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Than that which is to approach.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Then belike my children shall have no names:

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: prithee, how many boys and wenches must I have?

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: If every of your wishes had a womb.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: And fertile every wish, a million.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Out, fool! I forgive thee for a witch.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: You think none but your sheets are privy to your wishes.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Nay, come, tell Iras hers.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Well know all our fortunes.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Mine, and most of our fortunes, to-night, shall

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: be--drunk to bed.

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: Theres a palm presages chastity, if nothing else.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Een as the oerflowing Nilus presageth famine.

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: Go, you wild bedfellow, you cannot soothsay.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Nay, if an oily palm be not a fruitful

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: prognostication, I cannot scratch mine ear. Prithee,

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: tell her but a worky-day fortune.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: Your fortunes are alike.

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: But how, but how? give me particulars.

speaker: Soothsayer
text_entry: I have said.

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: Am I not an inch of fortune better than she?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Well, if you were but an inch of fortune better than

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: I, where would you choose it?

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: Not in my husbands nose.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Our worser thoughts heavens mend! Alexas,--come,

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: his fortune, his fortune! O, let him marry a woman

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: that cannot go, sweet Isis, I beseech thee! and let

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: her die too, and give him a worse! and let worst

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: follow worse, till the worst of all follow him

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: laughing to his grave, fifty-fold a cuckold! Good

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Isis, hear me this prayer, though thou deny me a

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: matter of more weight; good Isis, I beseech thee!

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: Amen. Dear goddess, hear that prayer of the people!

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: for, as it is a heartbreaking to see a handsome man

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: loose-wived, so it is a deadly sorrow to behold a

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: foul knave uncuckolded: therefore, dear Isis, keep

speaker: IRAS
text_entry: decorum, and fortune him accordingly!

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Amen.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Lo, now, if it lay in their hands to make me a

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: cuckold, they would make themselves whores, but

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: theyld dot!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Hush! here comes Antony.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Not he; the queen.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Saw you my lord?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: No, lady.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Was he not here?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: No, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: He was disposed to mirth; but on the sudden

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A Roman thought hath struck him. Enobarbus!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Madam?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Seek him, and bring him hither.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Wheres Alexas?

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Here, at your service. My lord approaches.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: We will not look upon him: go with us.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY with a Messenger and Attendants

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Fulvia thy wife first came into the field.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Against my brother Lucius?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Ay:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: But soon that war had end, and the times state

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Made friends of them, joining their force gainst Caesar;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Whose better issue in the war, from Italy,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Upon the first encounter, drave them.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Well, what worst?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The nature of bad news infects the teller.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: When it concerns the fool or coward. On:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Things that are past are done with me. Tis thus:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Who tells me true, though in his tale lie death,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I hear him as he flatterd.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Labienus--

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: This is stiff news--hath, with his Parthian force,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Extended Asia from Euphrates;

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: His conquering banner shook from Syria

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To Lydia and to Ionia; Whilst--

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Antony, thou wouldst say,--

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: O, my lord!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Speak to me home, mince not the general tongue:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Name Cleopatra as she is calld in Rome;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Rail thou in Fulvias phrase; and taunt my faults

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: With such full licence as both truth and malice

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Have power to utter. O, then we bring forth weeds,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: When our quick minds lie still; and our ills told us

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Is as our earing. Fare thee well awhile.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: At your noble pleasure.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Exit

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: From Sicyon, ho, the news! Speak there!

speaker: First Attendant
text_entry: The man from Sicyon,--is there such an one?

speaker: Second Attendant
text_entry: He stays upon your will.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let him appear.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: These strong Egyptian fetters I must break,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Or lose myself in dotage.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter another Messenger

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What are you?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Fulvia thy wife is dead.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Where died she?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: In Sicyon:

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Her length of sickness, with what else more serious

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Importeth thee to know, this bears.

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Gives a letter

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Forbear me.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit Second Messenger

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Theres a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What our contempt doth often hurl from us,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: By revolution lowering, does become

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The opposite of itself: shes good, being gone;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The hand could pluck her back that shoved her on.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I must from this enchanting queen break off:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: My idleness doth hatch. How now! Enobarbus!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Re-enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Whats your pleasure, sir?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I must with haste from hence.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Why, then, we kill all our women:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: we see how mortal an unkindness is to them;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: if they suffer our departure, deaths the word.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I must be gone.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Under a compelling occasion, let women die; it were

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: pity to cast them away for nothing; though, between

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: them and a great cause, they should be esteemed

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: nothing. Cleopatra, catching but the least noise of

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: this, dies instantly; I have seen her die twenty

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: times upon far poorer moment: I do think there is

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: mettle in death, which commits some loving act upon

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: her, she hath such a celerity in dying.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: She is cunning past mans thought.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exit ALEXAS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Alack, sir, no; her passions are made of nothing but

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: the finest part of pure love: we cannot call her

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: winds and waters sighs and tears; they are greater

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: storms and tempests than almanacs can report: this

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: cannot be cunning in her; if it be, she makes a

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: shower of rain as well as Jove.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Would I had never seen her.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: O, sir, you had then left unseen a wonderful piece

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: of work; which not to have been blest withal would

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: have discredited your travel.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Fulvia is dead.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Fulvia is dead.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Fulvia!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Dead.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Why, sir, give the gods a thankful sacrifice. When

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: it pleaseth their deities to take the wife of a man

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: from him, it shows to man the tailors of the earth;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: comforting therein, that when old robes are worn

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: out, there are members to make new. If there were

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: no more women but Fulvia, then had you indeed a cut,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: and the case to be lamented: this grief is crowned

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: with consolation; your old smock brings forth a new

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: petticoat: and indeed the tears live in an onion

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: that should water this sorrow.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The business she hath broached in the state

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Cannot endure my absence.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And the business you have broached here cannot be

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: without you; especially that of Cleopatras, which

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: wholly depends on your abode.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: No more light answers. Let our officers

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Have notice what we purpose. I shall break

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The cause of our expedience to the queen,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And get her leave to part. For not alone

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The death of Fulvia, with more urgent touches,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Do strongly speak to us; but the letters too

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of many our contriving friends in Rome

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Petition us at home: Sextus Pompeius

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Hath given the dare to Caesar, and commands

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The empire of the sea: our slippery people,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whose love is never linkd to the deserver

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Till his deserts are past, begin to throw

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Pompey the Great and all his dignities

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Upon his son; who, high in name and power,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Higher than both in blood and life, stands up

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For the main soldier: whose quality, going on,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The sides o the world may danger: much is breeding,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which, like the coursers hair, hath yet but life,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And not a serpents poison. Say, our pleasure,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To such whose place is under us, requires

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Our quick remove from hence.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I shall dot.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. Another room.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and ALEXAS

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Where is he?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: I did not see him since.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: See where he is, whos with him, what he does:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I did not send you: if you find him sad,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Say I am dancing; if in mirth, report

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That I am sudden sick: quick, and return.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit ALEXAS

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Madam, methinks, if you did love him dearly,

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: You do not hold the method to enforce

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: The like from him.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What should I do, I do not?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: In each thing give him way, cross him nothing.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou teachest like a fool; the way to lose him.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Tempt him not so too far; I wish, forbear:

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: In time we hate that which we often fear.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: But here comes Antony.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I am sick and sullen.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I am sorry to give breathing to my purpose,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Help me away, dear Charmian; I shall fall:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: It cannot be thus long, the sides of nature

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Will not sustain it.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Now, my dearest queen,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Pray you, stand further from me.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Whats the matter?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I know, by that same eye, theres some good news.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What says the married woman? You may go:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Would she had never given you leave to come!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Let her not say tis I that keep you here:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I have no power upon you; hers you are.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The gods best know,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, never was there queen

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So mightily betrayd! yet at the first

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I saw the treasons planted.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Cleopatra,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Why should I think you can be mine and true,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though you in swearing shake the throned gods,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Who have been false to Fulvia? Riotous madness,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To be entangled with those mouth-made vows,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Which break themselves in swearing!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Most sweet queen,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Nay, pray you, seek no colour for your going,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But bid farewell, and go: when you sued staying,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Then was the time for words: no going then;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Eternity was in our lips and eyes,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Bliss in our brows bent; none our parts so poor,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But was a race of heaven: they are so still,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or thou, the greatest soldier of the world,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Art turnd the greatest liar.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How now, lady!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I would I had thy inches; thou shouldst know

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: There were a heart in Egypt.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Hear me, queen:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The strong necessity of time commands

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Our services awhile; but my full heart

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Remains in use with you. Our Italy

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Shines oer with civil swords: Sextus Pompeius

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Makes his approaches to the port of Rome:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Equality of two domestic powers

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Breed scrupulous faction: the hated, grown to strength,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Are newly grown to love: the condemnd Pompey,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Rich in his fathers honour, creeps apace,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Into the hearts of such as have not thrived

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Upon the present state, whose numbers threaten;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And quietness, grown sick of rest, would purge

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: By any desperate change: my more particular,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And that which most with you should safe my going,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Is Fulvias death.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though age from folly could not give me freedom,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: It does from childishness: can Fulvia die?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Shes dead, my queen:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Look here, and at thy sovereign leisure read

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The garboils she awaked; at the last, best:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: See when and where she died.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O most false love!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Where be the sacred vials thou shouldst fill

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: With sorrowful water? Now I see, I see,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In Fulvias death, how mine received shall be.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Quarrel no more, but be prepared to know

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The purposes I bear; which are, or cease,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: As you shall give the advice. By the fire

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That quickens Nilus slime, I go from hence

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thy soldier, servant; making peace or war

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: As thou affectst.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Cut my lace, Charmian, come;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But let it be: I am quickly ill, and well,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So Antony loves.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: My precious queen, forbear;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And give true evidence to his love, which stands

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: An honourable trial.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So Fulvia told me.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I prithee, turn aside and weep for her,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Then bid adieu to me, and say the tears

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Belong to Egypt: good now, play one scene

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Of excellent dissembling; and let it look

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Life perfect honour.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Youll heat my blood: no more.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: You can do better yet; but this is meetly.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Now, by my sword,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And target. Still he mends;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But this is not the best. Look, prithee, Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: How this Herculean Roman does become

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The carriage of his chafe.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Ill leave you, lady.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Courteous lord, one word.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Sir, you and I must part, but thats not it:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Sir, you and I have loved, but theres not it;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That you know well: something it is I would,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, my oblivion is a very Antony,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And I am all forgotten.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: But that your royalty

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Holds idleness your subject, I should take you

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For idleness itself.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Tis sweating labour

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To bear such idleness so near the heart

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: As Cleopatra this. But, sir, forgive me;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Since my becomings kill me, when they do not

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Eye well to you: your honour calls you hence;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Therefore be deaf to my unpitied folly.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And all the gods go with you! upon your sword

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Sit laurel victory! and smooth success

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Be strewd before your feet!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let us go. Come;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Our separation so abides, and flies,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That thou, residing here, gost yet with me,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And I, hence fleeting, here remain with thee. Away!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESARs house.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, reading a letter, LEPIDUS, and their Train

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It is not Caesars natural vice to hate

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Our great competitor: from Alexandria

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: This is the news: he fishes, drinks, and wastes

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The lamps of night in revel; is not more man-like

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Than Cleopatra; nor the queen of Ptolemy

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: More womanly than he; hardly gave audience, or

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Vouchsafed to think he had partners: you shall find there

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: A man who is the abstract of all faults

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That all men follow.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: I must not think there are

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Evils enow to darken all his goodness:

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: His faults in him seem as the spots of heaven,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: More fiery by nights blackness; hereditary,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Rather than purchased; what he cannot change,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Than what he chooses.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You are too indulgent. Let us grant, it is not

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolemy;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

text_entry: But theres no goodness in thy face: if Antony

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Be free and healthful,--so tart a favour

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To trumpet such good tidings! If not well,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou shouldst come like a Fury crownd with snakes,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Not like a formal man.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Willt please you hear me?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I have a mind to strike thee ere thou speakst:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Yet if thou say Antony lives, is well,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or friends with Caesar, or not captive to him,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ill set thee in a shower of gold, and hail

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Rich pearls upon thee.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Madam, hes well.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Well said.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And friends with Caesar.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thourt an honest man.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Caesar and he are greater friends than ever.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Make thee a fortune from me.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: But yet, madam,--

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I do not like But yet, it does allay

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The good precedence; fie upon But yet!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But yet is as a gaoler to bring forth

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Some monstrous malefactor. Prithee, friend,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Pour out the pack of matter to mine ear,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The good and bad together: hes friends with Caesar:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In state of health thou sayst; and thou sayst free.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Free, madam! no; I made no such report:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Hes bound unto Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: For what good turn?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: For the best turn i the bed.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I am pale, Charmian.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Madam, hes married to Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The most infectious pestilence upon thee!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Strikes him down

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Good madam, patience.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What say you? Hence,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Strikes him again

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Horrible villain! or Ill spurn thine eyes

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Like balls before me; Ill unhair thy head:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: She hales him up and down

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou shalt be whippd with wire, and stewd in brine,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Smarting in lingering pickle.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Gracious madam,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I that do bring the news made not the match.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Say tis not so, a province I will give thee,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And make thy fortunes proud: the blow thou hadst

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Shall make thy peace for moving me to rage;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And I will boot thee with what gift beside

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thy modesty can beg.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Hes married, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Rogue, thou hast lived too long.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Draws a knife

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Nay, then Ill run.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: What mean you, madam? I have made no fault.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: The man is innocent.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Some innocents scape not the thunderbolt.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Melt Egypt into Nile! and kindly creatures

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Turn all to serpents! Call the slave again:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though I am mad, I will not bite him: call.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: He is afeard to come.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I will not hurt him.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit CHARMIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: These hands do lack nobility, that they strike

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A meaner than myself; since I myself

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Have given myself the cause.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Re-enter CHARMIAN and Messenger

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Come hither, sir.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though it be honest, it is never good

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To bring bad news: give to a gracious message.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: An host of tongues; but let ill tidings tell

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Themselves when they be felt.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I have done my duty.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Is he married?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I cannot hate thee worser than I do,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If thou again say Yes.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Hes married, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The gods confound thee! dost thou hold there still?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Should I lie, madam?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, I would thou didst,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So half my Egypt were submerged and made

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A cistern for scaled snakes! Go, get thee hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Hadst thou Narcissus in thy face, to me

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou wouldst appear most ugly. He is married?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I crave your highness pardon.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: He is married?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Take no offence that I would not offend you:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: To punish me for what you make me do.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Seems much unequal: hes married to Octavia.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, that his fault should make a knave of thee,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That art not what thourt sure of! Get thee hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The merchandise which thou hast brought from Rome

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Are all too dear for me: lie they upon thy hand,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And be undone by em!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit Messenger

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Good your highness, patience.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In praising Antony, I have dispraised Caesar.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Many times, madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I am paid fort now.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Lead me from hence:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I faint: O Iras, Charmian! tis no matter.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Go to the fellow, good Alexas; bid him

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Report the feature of Octavia, her years,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Her inclination, let him not leave out

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The colour of her hair: bring me word quickly.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exit ALEXAS

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Let him for ever go:--let him not--Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Though he be painted one way like a Gorgon,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The other ways a Mars. Bid you Alexas

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To MARDIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Bring me word how tall she is. Pity me, Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: But do not speak to me. Lead me to my chamber.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: SCENE VI. Near Misenum.

speaker: CLEOPATRA

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: And we shall talk before we fight.

text_entry: Most meet

text_entry: That first we come to words; and therefore have we

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Our written purposes before us sent;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: If twill tie up thy discontented sword,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And carry back to Sicily much tall youth

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That else must perish here.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To you all three,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: The senators alone of this great world,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Chief factors for the gods, I do not know

text_entry: Wherefore my father should revengers want,

text_entry: Having a son and friends; since Julius Caesar,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Who at Philippi the good Brutus ghosted,

text_entry: There saw you labouring for him. What wast

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: That moved pale Cassius to conspire; and what

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Made the all-honourd, honest Roman, Brutus,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: With the armd rest, courtiers and beauteous freedom,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To drench the Capitol; but that they would

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Have one man but a man? And that is it

text_entry: Hath made me rig my navy; at whose burthen

text_entry: The angerd ocean foams; with which I meant

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To scourge the ingratitude that despiteful Rome

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Cast on my noble father.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Take your time.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thou canst not fear us, Pompey, with thy sails;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Well speak with thee at sea: at land, thou knowst

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How much we do oer-count thee.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: At land, indeed,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Thou dost oer-count me of my fathers house:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: But, since the cuckoo builds not for himself,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Remain int as thou mayst.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Be pleased to tell us--

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: For this is from the present--how you take

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: The offers we have sent you.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Theres the point.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which do not be entreated to, but weigh

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What it is worth embraced.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And what may follow,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To try a larger fortune.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: You have made me offer

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Of Sicily, Sardinia; and I must

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Rid all the sea of pirates; then, to send

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Measures of wheat to Rome; this greed upon

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To part with unhackd edges, and bear back

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Our targes undinted.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Thats our offer.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Know, then,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I came before you here a man prepared

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To take this offer: but Mark Antony

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Put me to some impatience: though I lose

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: The praise of it by telling, you must know,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: When Caesar and your brother were at blows,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Your mother came to Sicily and did find

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Her welcome friendly.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I have heard it, Pompey;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And am well studied for a liberal thanks

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which I do owe you.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Let me have your hand:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I did not think, sir, to have met you here.

text_entry: The beds i the east are soft; and thanks to you,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That calld me timelier than my purpose hither;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For I have gaind by t.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Since I saw you last,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: There is a change upon you.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Well, I know not

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: What counts harsh fortune casts upon my face;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: But in my bosom shall she never come,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: To make my heart her vassal.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Well met here.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I hope so, Lepidus. Thus we are agreed:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I crave our composition may be written,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: And seald between us.

text_entry: Thats the next to do.

text_entry: Well feast each other ere we part; and lets

text_entry: That will I, Pompey.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: No, Antony, take the lot: but, first

speaker: POMPEY

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Grew fat with feasting there.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: You have heard much.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I have fair meanings, sir.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And fair words to them.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Then so much have I heard:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: And I have heard, Apollodorus carried--

text_entry: No more of that: he did so.

text_entry: What, I pray you?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: A certain queen to Caesar in a mattress.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I know thee now: how farest thou, soldier?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Well;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And well am like to do; for, I perceive,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Four feasts are toward.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Let me shake thy hand;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I never hated thee: I have seen thee fight,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: When I have envied thy behavior.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I never loved you much; but I ha praised ye,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: When you have well deserved ten times as much

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: As I have said you did.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Enjoy thy plainness,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: It nothing ill becomes thee.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Aboard my galley I invite you all:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Will you lead, lords?

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Show us the way, sir.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Come.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Exeunt all but MENAS and ENOBARBUS

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: [Aside]  Thy father, Pompey, would neer have

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: made this treaty.--You and I have known, sir.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: At sea, I think.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: We have, sir.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: You have done well by water.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And you by land.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I will praise any man that will praise me; though it

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: cannot be denied what I have done by land.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Nor what I have done by water.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Yes, something you can deny for your own

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: safety: you have been a great thief by sea.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And you by land.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: There I deny my land service. But give me your

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: hand, Menas: if our eyes had authority, here they

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: might take two thieves kissing.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: All mens faces are true, whatsomeer their hands are.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: But there is never a fair woman has a true face.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: No slander; they steal hearts.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: We came hither to fight with you.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: For my part, I am sorry it is turned to a drinking.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Pompey doth this day laugh away his fortune.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: If he do, sure, he cannot weept back again.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Youve said, sir. We looked not for Mark Antony

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: here: pray you, is he married to Cleopatra?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Caesars sister is called Octavia.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: True, sir; she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: But she is now the wife of Marcus Antonius.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Pray ye, sir?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Tis true.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Then is Caesar and he for ever knit together.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: If I were bound to divine of this unity, I would

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: not prophesy so.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: I think the policy of that purpose made more in the

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: marriage than the love of the parties.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I think so too. But you shall find, the band that

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: seems to tie their friendship together will be the

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: very strangler of their amity: Octavia is of a

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: holy, cold, and still conversation.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Who would not have his wife so?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Not he that himself is not so; which is Mark Antony.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: He will to his Egyptian dish again: then shall the

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: sighs of Octavia blow the fire up in Caesar; and, as

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I said before, that which is the strength of their

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: amity shall prove the immediate author of their

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: variance. Antony will use his affection where it is:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: he married but his occasion here.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And thus it may be. Come, sir, will you aboard?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: I have a health for you.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I shall take it, sir: we have used our throats in Egypt.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Come, lets away.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: the flow o the Nile

text_entry: contradiction, I have heard that.

text_entry: what ist?

text_entry: thee, captain,

text_entry: What manner o thing is your crocodile?

text_entry: as it hath breadth: it is just so high as it is,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Tis a strange serpent.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Tis so. And the tears of it are wet.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Will this description satisfy him?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: very epicure.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: [Aside to MENAS]  Go hang, sir, hang! Tell me of

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: that? away!
